body.p: To verify TinTri integration, you will use the graphical user interface in Horizon to verify the backend is running and that you can create a virtual machine (VM). Horizon is an OpenStack project that provides a dashboard to bring together all OpenStack projects in one place. By building custom dashboards it is possible to seamlessly integrate external components or services with OpenStack.

section.title: Accessing Horizon
section.p: Horizon dashboards provide a web-based user interface to HPE Helion OpenStack services including Compute, Volume Operations, Networking, and Identity.

To access a Horizon dashboard, you must know its hostname or IP address. If your administrator set a hostname value during the configuration process for your cloud, then Horizon will be accessed over port 80 on that hostname. If your administrator did not set a hostname value, then you can run a command to determine which IP address to use.

To log on to a Horizon dashboard, you must also know the username and password. The default username for the Administrator user is admin. In order to find the randomized password that is created by default you will need to look into a service file on the lifecycle manager.

p.b: To find the hostname or IP address:

ol.li: Log on to the lifecycle manager node (deployer node).
Find and open the following file in a text editor: Network_groups.yml
To check if your administrator set a hostname, find the following variable: External_name
If there is a value for external_name, then Horizon will be accessed over port 80 on that hostname. For example: If external_name=mycloud, then use mycloud:80 to access Horizon.
If there is no value set for external_name, then to find the IP address, run: grep vip-HZN-WEB /etc/hosts
Use the output of that command as the virtual IP address to access the Horizon dashboard.
Log on to the lifecycle manager node (deployer node).
To find the password, run: Cat ~/service.osrc

p.b: To access and log on to a Horizon dashboard:

ol.li: Open a web browser that has both JavaScript and cookies enabled.
In the address bar, enter the host name or IP address for the dashboard.
On the Log In page, enter your user name and password and then click Sign In.

section.title: Verify the TinTri Backend
section.p: To verify the TinTri backend is running:

ol.li: In the Horizon dashboard, look in the list on the left side. Verify you can see Admin.
In the list on the left side, click on System Information.
At the top, click Block Storage Services.
Verify that the cinder volume for the TinTri host you created is listed.

section.title: Create a New Virtual Machine (VM)
section.p: To create a new VM in Horizon:

ol.li: In the Horizon dashboard, on the left side, click Project.
In the list on the left side, click Compute.
Under Compute, click Volumes.
At the top of the screen on the right side, click +Create Volume.
Verify that it is listed on the Volumes tab.
